column5: Dodged the Fires surrounding all the camps and Lodge, water 2 1/2 ft low but 100 plus fish each day Pike (ave 32-39, 9 over 40, 43 was the biggest)and walleye (ave 20-25in), and some lakers in a 3 hour period one morning (8-14 lbs) The guys at Stevens-Nicklin did even better 2 47" pike and 8 lakers over 40 in, 2 28 in walleye. High numbers also. Hopefully a video of a white wolf too.
Can't wait to see the pics and video, Sam. Glad you had a great trip! John
Great stuff. What was the camp like? Being Ganglers I'll guess pretty nice.

Camp manager was great too. Bund beds with mattresses and sheets, pillows & sleeping bags included. Food top notch, same as at lodge we just had to cook. The camp Guy Dave grilled dinner for us, pork chops, steaks, ribs, chicken, and walleye at our request. Ran the generator when we were in camp and we shut it off when we went to bed. Had a propane heater besides the wood burner so we could just sue it as needed. Boats and motors all good , flat boards in floor for better standing. Looks pretty much like the photos on website.http://www.ganglers.com/pages/clifton_outpost.html
I am having trouble getting the wolf video to load?? Help!
Sounds like a great trip. I have looked at going there for some time now just have not made it.
